text:
Good morning guys. So right now we are 
 getting all bunch of rainjackets and
hats and warm weather gear on, because we are going to be
taking a helicopter up to the Fox Glacier to do a little heli-hiking.

I'm really excited about this. Last time I 
 was here I got to do
Franz Joseph glacier and we were only hiking at the bottom, but now

we are going to be taking the helicopter 
 all the way to the top.
That's pretty awesome.

So we landed on the glacier. We have 
 our crampons on, we have our sticks
and now we are going to start hiking.
Man: That there pushes out to give the slope some layers, and there
is a classic example here these little layers that have been pushed up
They are called compression arches. Some are quite big, big enough

that we can go in. That is ne way these caves form 
 and they are all at right angles to the slope.
Oh my goodness, oh my goodness. I love this room...
its like an igloo, an actual igloo. Girl: Its cold though....I know
How far does it go? There, but there is water.

I love ice caves. This is amazing. I was trying 
 to build them when I was younger,
in the snow pile that would pile up from my driveway.
Never as impressive as this.
Having fun? Girl: yes. It's a little slippery, but its so pretty, beautiful.
Spectacular.
Good evening. Now I am taking the Skyline Gondola up to the
Skyline Lounge to have a wonderful six course dinner, something ridicules
these courses are, but... yea. One of the bonuses of this popular ride is
you get a beautiful, amazing view of Queenstown.
This is the most amazing thing I have ever seen in my life.
I am so excited for this buffet.
